event.title: an exploration from Toronto to Balsam Lake, by way of Lake Simcoe, in 1791

data.event: The eastern boundary of Bradford is the Holland River, named for Samuel Holland, first Surveyor General of British North America, who passed this way on an exploration from Toronto to Balsam Lake, by way of Lake Simcoe, in 1791.

event.title: several years the Holland River and Lake Simcoe provided

data.event: For several years the Holland River and Lake Simcoe provided the only means of transportation.
The military route to Georgian Bay during the War of 1812 crossed Lake Simcoe to Kempenfelt Bay, then by the Nine Mile Portage to Willow Creek and the Nottawasaga River.
